result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd L Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs orders bond on file to be applied. Costs are paid in full.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Amended
from DA Blader w/Attachments Re: Amendment to Order for PSI to Include DRI of Companion Case No. 2015CF000171
Sentencing hearing at 02-16-2016 09:00 am

12:07 pm cases called. 15CF47, 15CF109, 15CF171, & 15TR685. Defendant Todd L Mueller in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Defendant Todd L Mueller in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Global resolution reached on all pending matters. Agreement read into record by DA Blader. Attorney Goldin concurs.  15CF109-Preliminary hearing discussed-defendant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant regarding waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and enters an order binding defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Goldin confirms receipt, waives formal reading.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 of 15CF54 & No Contest to 15CF109.   Court dismisses outright Count 2 of 15CF54. Court dismisses and reads-in 15CF171 & 15TR685. Court revokes bond and requests sentencing hearing be scheduled.  Court accepts plea and orders a PSI be completed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing
to Forfeit Bond

STC/Final pre-trial at 12-03-2015 12:00 pm.
STC/Jury trial at 12-17-2015 08:00 am.

15CF-54, 15CF-109 and15TR-685 - All Cases Called @ 2:08 PM: Defendant Todd L Mueller in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Goldin states his client will be requesting an adjourned plea date today.  Argument for adjournment however was prepared to enter pleas today to the 2 charges - PSI was to be requested with arrangements for in-patient treatment.   Argument by DA:  Respects position taken by Atty Goldin today and concerns explained for continue adjournment.  Potential may exist today as to suspected bond violation.  Atty Goldin has no knowledge of potential bond violations today.  Court will require the immediate scheduling of a Jury Trial.   JT and FPT Scheduled.  Court has lost patience with adjournments in this process.  Jury trial scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 12:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-13-2015 02:15 pm

Per Atty Goldin - requests add'l STC as he is still trying to deal with all the pending matters.  STC adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 15CF-54 and 15CF-109 - Both Cases Called @ 1:34 PM:  15CF-109:    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 10 day time limits for preliminary hearing.  ADA argues as to current bond ordered.  Documentation provided for Court's review which indicates he has been cleared to be in WCJ.  Def has been violating terms of EMD.  Argument by Atty Goldin as to State's request.  Court reinstates all previous conditions of bond that had been established.  Medical issue no longer precludes his stay in the WCJ jail.  Def remanded into custody on previous bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 03:10 pm.
from DA Blader Re: Amendment to Cash Bond Conditions
of Judge Dutcher to Counsel and Jail Administrator Re: Authorization of GPS/EMD
from Corrections Corporal J. Knier Re: GPS Bracelet for Defendant
Initial appearance at 08-11-2015 01:15 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles.

15CF-54 and 15CF-109 - Both Cases Called @ 3:15 PM: Defendant Todd L Mueller in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Golden states for the record that he is formally not appointed as to new matter and Def has been instructed to contact SPD for new appointment.  15CF-109:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  DA requests the Court to revisit bond previously ordered 15CF-54.  Violation of bond has occurred.  Argues for a total bond as to both matters for an add'l $2000 with $1500 cash already posted.  Atty Goldin argues as to cash bond amendment.  The Court:  Recognizes what has been alleged.  $5000 Cash Bond ordered as to 15CF-109.  Court appreciates Def's injuries.  If the Jail in its judgment believes that bond should be revisited, the Court to be made aware of same.  STC as to 15CF-54 and IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and finds probable cause exists as to Ct 1 of the Complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
